results.title: Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
About NeuraFlash:

We are a leading AI and Consulting Partner of Amazon & Salesforce obsessed with helping our customers transform their contact centers with AI Powered Experiences. Our expertise spans across the Amazon ecosystem with Amazon Connect, Lex & Contact Lens and Salesforce ecosystem with Service Cloud Voice, Einstein Bots and Digital Channels, Service Cloud, Field Service, CPQ, MuleSoft, and Einstein Analytics. We are experts in building experiences grounded in data that transform and optimize the employee and customer journey.

What sets NeuraFlash apart?

At NeuraFlash, our people form the core of our business and the soul of our brand. We hire individuals who inspire us and look at challenges as opportunities to create innovative solutions. You’ll be provided with ongoing education and development opportunities via our Salesforce Partnership Program and mentorship programs created for our aspiring leaders. NeuraFlash is on the forefront of cutting-edge technologies and we understand by investing in you, we’re investing in ourselves!

As the first Product Marketing Manager at NeuraFlash, you will drive go-to-market initiatives for NeuraFlash’s growing suite of Salesforce AppExchange and Amazon Marketplace products and packages. Utilizing a wide range of marketing techniques in tight collaboration with our VP of Marketing, you will create messaging that drives the opportunity pipeline and promotes our products to existing and potential customers across several industries. In addition, this person will need to stay close with the sales organization and product leadership from our partners, to always have a forward-thinking roadmap in future releases and products to take advantage of the market opportunities and create continuous differentiation for NeuraFlash. 

The Product Marketing Manager will be responsible for product launches, GTM strategy, value propositions, videos, demos, customer renewals, awareness, and more. 

AS PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER, YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO: 

  • Develop go-to-market strategy for new and existing products 
  • Ensure our existing and new customers renew their license agreements, take advantage of new features, and add-on additional products from NeuraFlash
  • Train Sales team members on product features 
  • Educate and create high awareness of the broader Salesforce, Amazon, and other markets
  • Continue to create differentiation for our products and the NeuraFlash brand
  • Stay close to the sales, CSG, and delivery teams as well as our technology partners
  • Present to executives and stakeholders on product launches and value propositions 
  • Understand customers’ needs and challenges and create targeted campaigns and launches
  • Partner with sales, product, and other cross functional teams to drive alignment on new releases 
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Driven leader that is excited about the product opportunities with Salesforce/Amazon and others
  • 5+ years of product marketing or product GTM strategy experience
  • Background in Product Marketing or related field within the Salesforce and/or Amazon AWS CRM space
  • Strong ability to identify and utilize customer needs to tell an inspiring story about our product solution 
  • Confident presentation and training skills in front of all organizational levels 
  • Hands-on experience and willingness to create content strategies and lead their execution
  • Provide leadership and mentorship to the internal NeuraFlash product teams
  • Collaborates well with all of the NeuraFlash key stakeholders across Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Managed Services, and Delivery
  • Build strong relationships with product leadership at Salesforce and Amazon
What’s it like to be a part of NeuraFlash?
  • Remote & In-Person: Whether you work out of our HQ in Massachusetts, one of our regional hubs, our India office, or you're one of over half of our NeuraFlash Family who work remotely, we’re focused on keeping everyone connected and unified as one team.
  • Flexibility: Do you have to take the dog to the vet, pick up the kids from school, or the in-laws from the airport? We know that a perfect 9-5 isn’t possible. So you have to jump out to do any of those, no problem! We build a culture of trust and understanding. We value good work not the hours in which you get it done
  • Collaboration: You have a voice here!  If you work with a team of smart people like we do, it’s a no-brainer to take suggestions and feedback on how to keep NeuraFlash thriving.  Our executive team holds town halls & company meetings where they address any suggestions or questions asked, no matter how big or small.
  • Celebrate Often: We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Whether it is an arm wrestling contest, costume party, or ugly holiday sweaters our teams love to have fun. And while we work hard, we don’t forget to slow down and celebrate the big things and the small things together.
The “Flashy” Perks:
  • Be in the right space: Work at the forefront of AI & Innovation on the Salesforce Platform.
  • Growth: In 2021, we grew our team by close to 90%, and we plan to do the same again this year!  There’s no limit to where your career at NeuraFlash can go.
     
  • L&D Program: We are invested in your success. This program was built to help our employees advance in their career in Salesforce and at NeuraFlash.
  • Mentorship Program: Each new team member is assigned a mentor to help them acclimate at NeuraFlash.
  • Monthly & Weekly Socials: We hold monthly & weekly virtual socials to have more opportunities to be together.
  • Company Retreats: This looks a little different in the age of COVID-19 but we gather the entire company twice a year to share stories & visions for NeuraFlash.  

Location: NeuraFlash strives to provide you with the flexibility to work in the location that makes the most sense for your lifestyle. For those that prefer an office setting, this role may be based in any of our hub locations within the United States, India, and British Columbia, Canada. If you prefer to work from your home, we can accommodate remote locations anywhere in the United States for our U.S. based employees, and anywhere within British Columbia for our Canadian employees !

results.title: Software Release Manager
results.description:
Your role


Notability is an industry-leading note taking application with expressive drawing capabilities that make full use of the power of the Apple Pencil and iPad Pro. This is an open role for someone who can join us in continuing to deliver incredible new features that strike a delicate balance between simplicity and power, ensuring that Notability continues to be the best note-taking experience in the world.

We are looking for a release manager to join our app team to help us continuously deliver updates for Notability across iOS and Mac platforms. We strive to consistently deliver new features while maintaining a high quality user experience.

Your responsibilities
  • Solve difficult problems that feature soft real-time performance targets 
  • Manage weekly releases to continuously deliver new features and fixes to users on Mac and iOS platforms
  • Mediate between engineering, QA, and product teams to ensure releases are timely and of the highest quality
  • Build and send beta versions of the app to testers via TestFlight
  • Coordinate with a translation service to translate new strings for the app and website
  • Monitor operational issues and crash rates and escalate new or growing issues via the proper channels
  • Deliver hot fix releases if needed in a timely manner
  • Collaborate with engineering and across the organization effectively to deliver stellar new features, and address technical issues
  • Communicate release status effectively to different stakeholders including product, design, support, QA and management
  • Identify bottlenecks with and propose improvements to our release process
Requirements
  • 5+ years of experience.
  • Proven track record with software release management
  • Expertise in git and continuous integrations services such as CircleCI
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to easily collaborate with others
  • Ability to cultivate consensus and alignment within and across teams
  • Value continuous learning, experimentation and improving
    How we Work

    Each member of our team contributes to all parts of our products. We trust each other to make decisions independently while also considering our common goals and values. We share ideas openly, and we collaborate across disciplines to ensure that our decisions make sense from all perspectives.

    When We Work

    We keep work and life balanced. We set our schedules based on our excitement to solve a problem, and we trust each other to get things done. We work from home when it will help, and we have an “as long as you get your work done” vacation policy.

    Where We Work

    We work in downtown SF near Market Street, just a short walk from two BART/Muni stations. Our open-plan office has height-adjustable desks to help us stay limber, a trio of rooms for small group meetings or individual work, and a shuffleboard table to help us stay coordinated (or to enjoy during happy hour :).

    Remote Work

    We are open to full-time remote employees who reside in the U.S.

    Benefits
    • Competitive compensation in form of base salary, bonuses and profit sharing
    • Comprehensive healthcare fully covered for you and your family
    • Flexible work and vacation schedules
    • 401k with matching contributions
    • Matching gifts to non-profits
    • Public transit reimbursement
    • Home workstation reimbursement
    • ISP reimbursement
    • Monthly phone bill reimbursement

results.title: Ruby Backend Developer
results.description:
We are seeking an experienced Ruby backend developer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing and implementing scalable and maintainable backend systems using Ruby and related technologies.

Wolf SaaS marketplaces have helped 200,000+ job seekers find flexible work in their communities, while helping over 7,000 hospitals, restaurants, and families find the nurses, servers, and babysitters they need. As part of our mission to launch the next 1,000 talent marketplaces, we're looking for a backend engineer with experience in Ruby to optimize our system development and performance.

We're recent Techstars alumni, having just gone through the Techstars Anywhere 2022 program and just closed our seed round. Our fully remote, multicultural team has employees in 3 countries and is growing fast!

What you bring to the table:

  • 3+ years of professional experience as a backend developer
  • Strong proficiency in Ruby and related technologies (e.g. Rails)
  • Experience with REST APIs and microservices
  • Experience with database design and SQL
  • Experience with Git and version control
  • Strong problem-solving and communication skills
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field (preferred)

What you'll be doing:

  • Design and implement scalable and maintainable backend systems using Ruby and related technologies
  • Collaborate with the product and design teams to understand requirements and develop solutions
  • Write clean, well-documented code that follows best practices
  • Participate in code reviews and ensure that all team members are following best practices
  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and tools

Would be a plus:

  • Experience or interest in SaaS or HR/Staffing softwares
  • Knowledge of on-demand staffing industry or talent marketplaces

What we offer:

  • Ability to work remotely
  • Employee stock options and annual performance bonuses
  • Opportunity to learn exciting new skills and grow your career
  • This is a full-time, remote position based in Chile or Colombia

results.title: Backend Engineer, Delivery:Orchestration
results.description:
The GitLab DevOps platform empowers 100,000+ organizations to deliver software faster and more efficiently. We are one of the world’s largest all-remote companies with 2,000+ team members and values that guide a culture where people embrace the belief that everyone can contribute.

The Delivery team is responsible for guaranteeing and improving the software delivery for GitLab.com, as well as self-managed users by improving the release management tooling and processes. Delivery engineers work closely with teams across Development, Quality, Security, and Reliability Engineering to ensure features are delivered in a safe, scalable and efficient fashion.

Responsibilities

Backend Engineers with Delivery:Orchestration specialization work alongside Site Reliability Engineers with a focus primarily on improving release management tooling and processes. While the SRE's approach their responsibilities from an operational perspective, Backend Engineers approach the same problems from a software developer point of view and collaborate closely on finding an optimal solution that will safely and quickly deliver code to various supported environments.

  • Guarantees the GitLab Release Process
  • Creates new tools to automate the release process
  • Builds new GitLab release features to replace existing custom tooling
  • Works with individual teams on defining and implementing solutions that will help them release quicker
  • Creates frameworks that allow engineers to write code that scales with demand
  • Helps teams instrument their code and helps recognize parts of code that could benefit from increased observability
  • Works closely with peer Infrastructure teams to control the impact of application code running in user facing products
  • Helps communicate the release schedule clearly with others
  • Develop monitoring and alerting to measure release process velocity
  • Identify process bottlenecks and introduce optimizations

Requirements

As an ideal candidate you will have 

  • Proficiency with Ruby on Rails or other Ruby frameworks
  • Boundless curiosity and a demonstrable ability to learn
  • Experience working on large scale systems
  • Experience optimizing Continuous Delivery and Continuous Deployment pipelines as well as the tooling and processes that go with them
  • A strong application and systems observability background

 You share our values, and work in accordance with those values.

Performance indicators

The Delivery team has the following performance indicators:

  • Mean Time to Production 
Compensation

To view the full job description and its compensation calculator, view our handbook. The compensation calculator can be found towards the bottom of the page.

Additional details about our process can be found on our hiring page.

The base salary range for this role’s listed level is currently $89,600 - $163,200 for Colorado residents and $89,600 - $182,400 for New York and New Jersey residents only. Grade level and salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant, equity with other team members, and alignment with market data. See more information on our benefits and equity. Sales roles are also eligible for incentive pay targeted at up to 100% of the offered base salary.

Country Hiring Guidelines: GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process.  

Privacy Policy: Please review our Recruitment Privacy Policy. Your privacy is important to us.

GitLab is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. GitLab’s policies and practices relating to recruitment, employment, career development and advancement, promotion, and retirement are based solely on merit, regardless of race, color, religion, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression), national origin, age, citizenship, marital status, mental or physical disability, genetic information (including family medical history), discharge status from the military, protected veteran status (which includes disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, active duty wartime or campaign badge veterans, and Armed Forces service medal veterans), or any other basis protected by law. GitLab will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. See also GitLab’s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know during the recruiting process.

results.title: Recruitment Partner
results.description:
Company Description

Recruitment Partner

Our Chief Operating Officer started at The Curve Group as a Resourcing Consultant, she now runs all of our operations. This isn’t unusual here – our Projects Director, Head of Recruitment Operations, Head of Client Services, Resourcing Leads and many others have had the same career trajectory.

Business is booming and our Recruitment Outsourcing team is growing, we’re looking for a Recruitment Partner for one of our outsourced recruitment clients.

This is still a hands on Recruitment role where you will also manage and partner with senior stakeholders within the business.



Job Description

Ideally you’ll be coming from an RPO environment and have a strong background as a hands on recruiter and have a solid understanding of the end-to-end recruitment outsource model. In addition to this, you’ll have a great track record in:

  • Delivering high volume and professional/technical recruitment through a best-in-class delivery team
  • Business partnering senior stakeholders up to ExCo/Director level and a proven understanding of what it takes to build strong relationships with key stakeholders whilst challenging and influencing their thinking and actions

What’s involved

  • Overall responsibility for the end-to-end recruitment process, working with delivery teams – planning and developing appropriate resourcing strategies in line with this
  • Hands on recruitment delivery
  • Advising on EVP (Employee Value Proposition) and promoting employer brand - measured by how this is effectively communicated to the external market
  • Advising on assessment techniques
  • Being the Initial point of escalation for any issues and then managing these through to resolution effectively
  • Manage the engagement, relationship and performance of 3rd party agency partners working with Supply Chain Management Team
  • Analysing, interpreting and presenting management information back to your client
  • Creating, inputting into and maintaining a strategic account management plan
  • Accurately forecasting revenue from your client, highlighting any risks
  • Leading/attending client review meetings as required



Qualifications



Additional Information

Let’s be honest, in the current market there are a ton of opportunities for a person like you – so why is this job any different?

  • We’re the UK’s largest privately owned HR & Recruitment provider. Our growth over the last 16 years has been extraordinary, we’re now nearing 100 staff
  • Flexible working from client site in London and home
  • 35 hour working week - fancy an afternoon off once per week?
  • 25 days holiday to start, with the option to buy 5 more. Your standard holiday entitlement increases a day per year (to 30 days) with the option to buy more
  • Beautiful offices in a converted barn in the Northamptonshire countryside – with cows, chickens and the occasional horse
  • Great socials including Curvefest - our very own festival and ‘thank you’ from management full of fun, food, frivolity and bands
  • We’ve been recognised as both innovative and disruptive and we have the awards to prove it! (‘Most Innovative Recruitment Company’, ‘Recruitment Process Outsourcer of the Year’, ‘Best Customer Focus’, ‘Best Employer’ and ‘Best Customer Service’)

results.title: Payroll Manager
results.description:
Company Description

Since 1940, Dairy Queen® has been one of the world’s best known and loved brands. Based in Minneapolis, MN, International Dairy Queen Inc., (IDQ), is the parent company of American Dairy Queen Corporation. As a leading franchisor, there are more than 7,000 independently owned and operated restaurants in the U.S., Canada and more than 20 countries around the world. IDQ is a subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. (Berkshire) which is led by Warren Buffett, the legendary investor and CEO of Berkshire.

Here at IDQ, we create extraordinary Fan experiences every day and we do this through our commitment to hiring and retaining only the best in class talent. We firmly believe that our employees are the catalyst to the success of the company where their initiative, strategic thinking, and entrepreneurial spirit are recognized and rewarded. We're looking for motivated, passionate and dedicated individuals with an inherent need and ambition to go after bigger challenges.



Job Description

We have an exciting opportunity available for a Payroll Manager located at our Corporate headquarters in Bloomington, MN.  The Payroll Manager is an individual contributor role that manages the payroll function for International Dairy Queen/ADQ and its subsidiaries including corporate employees in the United States, Canada, and International as well as Corporate Stores employees, ensuring employees are paid on a timely and accurate basis and ensuring compliance with the federal, state and local government requirements.  Research and recommend opportunities for best practice operations in the payroll function.

Principle Accountabilities Include:

  • Manage bi-weekly and semi-monthly disbursement of multi-state and international payroll (about 500 employees), including garnishments, benefits and taxes, for all employees and locations consistent with federal and state wage and hour laws.
  • Ensure the processing of new hires, temporary workers, transfers, promotions and terminations is accurate and timely.  Ensure systems are set-up and updated to reflect our current employee base, including wages, benefits, sick and vacation time.
  • Critically review and analyze current payroll, benefits and tax procedures in order to recommend and implement changes for best-practice operations. Maintain payroll guidelines by writing and updating policies and procedures.
  • Communicate continuously and openly with HR and appropriate departments to review cross-departmental impacts and reconcile data sharing.  Partner with HR in maintaining a sophisticated payroll and benefits system.
  • Prepare and review payroll journal entries and related general ledger account reconciliations.
  • Ensure all payroll information and records are maintained in accordance with statutory requirements.
  • Manage regular preparation of relevant management reports, including weekly, monthly, quarterly and year-end reports (gross payroll, hours worked, vacation accrual, tax deductions, benefit deductions, etc.).
  • Maintain payroll expertise with payroll regulations through external study and regular networking with payroll professionals.

 



Qualifications

Education/Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Business Administration.
  • Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) preferred.
  • 5+ years of experience managing a multi-state payroll department
  • Previous experience and strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications(Excel, Word) and payroll applications, such as UltiPro, ADP or PeopleSoft (UltiPro required)

Skills:

  • Working experience of payroll tax at the federal, state and local levels; experience with Canadian wage and tax regulations/laws a plus.
  • Creative thinker who can continuously develop ideas for process improvement
  • Relationship building skills with the ability to create mutually beneficial relationships with both internal and external clients
  • Strong communication skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong ability to multi-task and prioritize multiple projects and requests simultaneously, within a deadline-driven environment
  • Well organized with a high attention to detail and accuracy
  • Strong analytical skills



Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.   You must be work authorized in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship.

 

Benefits

Benefit package includes medical, dental and vision insurance coverage, employer paid basic life insurance, short and long-term disability, paid sick and vacation, 401(k) match, tuition reimbursement, wellness challenges and more!

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

We are committed to creating a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion for all who touch DQ.  We believe in and commit to fostering a community where employees bring their authentic selves to work; where we recruit, engage and retain employees, franchise owners and suppliers with diverse background and identities; and where everyone feels welcome engaging with our DQ brand.

 

IDQ is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace. IDQ participates in the US E-Verify program.  You must be work authorized in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship.

results.title: Senior Front End Developer (React)
results.description:
Our Senior Front End Developer will help take our web application and stack to the next level. We're looking for a dynamic engineer who is no stranger to building well-designed, performant and effective front end web applications that support complex business rules. You will start by learning from the experiences of our current team and our current offerings and become intimately familiar with our codebase. As you improve in your understanding of our business logic, you will contribute your front end experience by adding features to our existing web app, which supports thousands of customers.

What You'll Do
  • Contribute to new and existing projects by developing and maintaining a reliable set of edge applications
  • Partner with UX and Product Management to translate complex business flows into friendly UI experiences
  • Build shared microservices that can serve multiples applications and scale independently
  • Enable our team to tap into our valuable data sources and build incredible features for our customers
  • Provide constructive feedback on pull requests to increase code quality
Your First 90 Days

In your First 30 Days, you will immerse yourself in our team, tech stack and development culture. You will work with your Lead to better understand our web app offering. You will help implement our front end technical roadmap, which takes scalability, testing, and performance into account, and present a gap analysis on what can be done even better. You will take on development items, getting your hands in our current web stack (75-90% of your time). 

In your First 60 Days, along with user stories and product features, you will help work on a backlog of technical infrastructure work identified in your First 30 Days. You will help drive an efficient and effective SDLC and work to learn and better support your Scrum Team (Product Management, QA, fellow Developers). 

In your First 90 Days, you will help instill the discipline of effectively monitoring and creating work items from production issues. You will further our tech stack by continuing to help implement our technical roadmap and future deliveries. You will further play a meaningful role in helping hire future members of our growing Product Team. 

Who You Are
  • 5+ years' experience developing single-page web applications
  • Depth of experience with React or other modern front end frameworks (e.g., Angular, Vue)
  • Ability to flesh out user stories to be consumed by the rest of your team
  • Experience working in an Agile environment (e.g., Scrum, Kanban)
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with ability to collaborate with remote team members
  • Excellent technical design, problem-solving and debugging skills
Your Differentiators
  • Prior experience with C# or Java
  • Bachelor's in Computer Science preferred

Our Values

  • We are a Team. Employees, customers, and partners working together.
  • We are Customer-Focused. Customers are the heart of everything we do.
  • We are Driven. Seeking exceptional outcomes.
  • We Own our Success. Every employee has a stake in our company.
  • We do the right thing and have fun in the process.

The salary range for this opportunity is $130,000 - $140,000 per year. You will be eligible for discretionary bonus compensation, subject to plans that may be in effect from time to time. You will further be eligible to participate in Unanet's employee benefits plans and programs. For more details on Unanet's benefits offerings, please visit https://unanet.com/employee-benefits.

Unanet is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for positions without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Head of Development
results.description:
About Swing Left

Swing Left is a national grassroots organization working to elect Democrats up and down the ballot. We make it possible for anyone to make an impact on the elections that determine the balance of power in our country, by volunteering in and donating to key races. Since launching in 2017, Swing Left volunteers have raised $80 million for Democratic candidates, civic organizations, and voter mobilization efforts, and made more than 44 million combined phone calls, door knocks, and letters sent to voters via our affiliate Vote Forward and their partners.

About Vote Forward

Vote Forward is a 501(c)(4) nonprofit organization that builds tools to encourage Americans to vote. We work to increase the participation of traditionally underrepresented groups in the electorate, and to increase civic engagement among the public at large, by supporting the volunteers working to engage these voters. Since 2018, more than 250,000 grassroots volunteers have used the Vote Forward platform to send handwritten letters to more than 25 million prospective voters to encourage them to register to vote and turn out for elections. Vote Forward is closely affiliated with Swing Left, and Vote Forward staff work with Swing Left on many projects of mutual interest.

Overview

The primary responsibility of the Head of Development is to ensure Swing Left and Vote Forward have the financial resources necessary to execute their missions by leading the development and implementation of major donor and grassroots fundraising strategies in support of the organizations' annual operating budgets, as well as fundraising strategies for Swing Left target candidates and civic organizations. This role reports to the Managing Director and is an at-will position.

The Swing Left and Vote Forward team is fully remote, but there is an expectation for the Head of Development to attend in-person meetings and events in various locations around the country. Candidates should have the ability to travel regularly (approximately 5-8 days per month on average).

We aim to begin interviews for this position by early February. We expect to review the first batch of applications by January 20 and then will do a rolling review of applications until the position is filled and/or the application is closed. Please note that our office is closed between December 17 – January 2.

Responsibilities 

Lead the development, implementation, and execution of major donor and grassroots fundraising strategies for Swing Left and Vote Forward

  • Lead the development and implementation of cross-cutting fundraising strategies to drive goals––operational fundraising for Swing Left and Vote Forward, and fundraising for targeted candidates, campaigns and organizations, including via Blueprint
  • Directly manage the Development team, including consultants and full-time staff
  • Oversee the development and iterations of Blueprint, determine strategies for allocations, and work cross-functionally to maintain and grow its audience
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to develop and implement digital fundraising strategies with the Marketing team
  • Lead the assessment of the organization's existing strategies to identify priorities for program development and updates, and identify, develop, and implement new and improved strategies for fundraising 
  • Establish goals for fundraising, define systems and processes to measure success and track progress toward goals and work cross functionally to develop and implement strategies for meeting goals 

Oversee and lead the development, implementation, and execution of major donor strategy for Swing Left and Vote Forward and, in partnership with the Executive Director and rest of the development team, manage relationships with the organizations' major donors

  • Develop and implement fundraising strategies that will allow Swing Left and Vote Forward to accomplish their respective organizational goals
  • Oversee the research of potential major donors to gain insights into needs, beliefs, and donation habits to understand how to engage them in donating to Swing Left and Vote Forward
  • Identify, contact, and follow up with existing and prospective donors to provide information necessary for engagement
  • Develop programs that will engage and retain new and existing donors
  • Develop fundraising messages and collateral that are compelling to potential donors and consistent with the Swing Left and Vote Forward brands
  • Work with the Executive Director and development team to set fundraising goals and report on progress 
  • Work with the Executive Director and development team to build and strengthen relationships with donors and donor prospects
  • Organize campaigns and events that will lead to soliciting donors and/or in coordination with donors
  • Develop a process and structure for maintaining records of donor information and ensure accuracy of donor information
  • Develop and evaluate success of fundraising efforts and events and make adjustments to strategy as necessary
  • Develop donor and legal reporting documentation to ensure requirements are satisfied

Serve as a member of the organization's leadership team: collaborate with other leadership team members and executive leadership to analyze feedback from staff, identify areas of improvement, establish org-wide priorities and programs, and coordinate to ensure the success of cross-functional initiatives

Successful Head of Development candidates will have
  • A strong interest in Swing Left's mission and values
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills that demonstrate an ability to convey a compelling understanding of Swing Left and Vote Forward's mission and impact, and translate our data, research and analysis on strategy and electoral impact into persuasive narratives
  • At least 2 – 3 cycles (4 – 6 years) of increasing responsibility in a fundraising environment, with a proven track record of securing significant gifts from individuals, organizations, foundations, etc. 
  • Experience leading the creation and implementation of effective and successful donor cultivation and engagement programs
  • Experience with major donor fundraising in electoral, 501c(3), and 501c(4) contexts
  • Strongly prefer experience with digital fundraising in electoral, 501c(3), and 501c(4) contexts
  • Mastery of donor, principal, and key stakeholder relationship-building and management
  • Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively across teams in a remote environment
  • Ability to work under pressure and balance multiple priorities at once
  • Ability to diagnose problems quickly and foresee potential issues, and a strong solutions orientation
  • Demonstrated success managing and leading staff and building an impact-driven, collaborative team culture
  • A demonstrated commitment to equity and belonging across all identities including but not limited to race, gender, sexual orientation, age and ability. A specific track record of a commitment to BIPOC communities. 
  • A keen interest in being an intentional organizational leader, trusted thought partner to executive leadership, and critical individual contributor 
Working at Swing Left

The Development Lead position is a full-time, exempt and remote position. There is regular travel expected for this role (see more information in the Overview section of this posting). The pay range for this position is $148,565 – $165,073 on an annualized basis. We provide cost of living compensation increases at the beginning of each year. 

In addition to health, dental, vision, and retirement benefits, Swing Left's benefits package includes a professional development fund, a remote work fund, and a technology stipend for all employees. We have an unlimited time-off policy, a flexible medical and parental leave policy, and our office is closed for approximately 25 business days each year. We are happy to answer any questions you have about our benefits and policies in interviews.

We are an equal opportunity employer and seek applications from all qualified candidates who are eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas at this time. 

We welcome all applicants regardless of age, citizenship, gender identity or expression, national origin, pregnancy status, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other differences.

Please note the best way to express interest in this position is to submit an application––this is the most effective way for our team to review and process applications fairly and efficiently.

results.title: SEO and Content Marketing Expert Writer
results.description:
Growth Machine is seeking an outstanding writer who is well-versed in SEO and content marketing to work with us on an exciting new content project.

Requirements

For this project, you'll create long form (1,200-1,500 word), informational, SEO-friendly articles for the client's blog. We will provide you with keyword research and some training, but you should come to the table with a good working knowledge of the subject matter, the willingness to research any topics you need a little more information, and the ability to write engaging and informative, yet approachable articles about topics like keyword research, backlinks and site authority, and content marketing best practices.

Benefits

Since this is a freelance position, there are no benefits. The project pays a flat rate per article, and assuming we work well together, there is significant opportunity for future work, if you'd like to grow with us.

results.title: Senior Manager, Talent & Recruitment Consulting
results.description:
Company Description

KIPP Public Schools is a national network of public charter schools that prepares students with the skills and confidence to create the future they want for themselves, their communities, and us all. We are a network of 270 schools, nearly 10,000 educators, and more than 160,000 students and alumni.   

  
Our mission: Together with families and communities, we create joyful, academically excellent schools that prepare students with the skills and confidence to pursue the paths they choose—college, career, and beyond—so they can lead fulfilling lives and build a more just world.  

  

Our vision: Every child grows up free to create the future they want for themselves and their communities.  

  

The KIPP Foundation is a nonprofit organization that supports KIPP schools across the country. The KIPP Foundation trains and develops outstanding educators to lead KIPP public schools; provides tools, resources and training for excellent teaching and learning; promotes innovation; and facilitates the exchange of insights and ideas across KIPP and other public schools and organizations.  



Job Description

About The Position 

As the Senior Manager, Talent & Recruitment Consulting, you will be a key member of KIPP Foundation’s Network Talent Team, contributing to our team purpose to build and sustain healthy talent ecosystems within KIPP regions. You will support our strategy to build KIPP regions’ capacity to recruit and hire excellent, anti-racist teachers and leaders, ensuring that schools are 80% hired by the last day of school. You will partner closely with over 25 regions to create and iterate on the resources that support 125+ recruiters across the country, including the codified KIPP Recruitment Playbook that outlines research-backed best practices. You will also be the product manager for the network-wide Applicant Tracking System, helping our KIPP regions develop data monitoring systems that lead to equitable hiring practices and a diverse teacher workforce. 

 

Responsibilities 

As the Senior Manager, Talent & Recruitment Consulting, you will be responsible for: 

 

Strategy Development    

  • In collaboration with the Director, Talent & Recruitment Consulting, codify and define best practices for recruitment and selection of teachers and leaders to ensure schools are 80% hired by the last day of school 

  • Conduct research, synthesize findings and make recommendations on effective and equitable recruitment practices 

  • Lead process to revise and project manage the KIPP Recruitment Playbook, managing workload across the team and ensuring playbook publication strategy meets regional needs 

  • Support in designing the strategy to develop KIPP’s regional recruiters and recruitment team managers  

  • Collaborate with all team members to continuously identify opportunities for improvement and increased efficiency in cross-team work 

   

Management and Execution   

  • Partner with regions to build their recruitment systems and practices so that they create robust and equitable recruitment pipelines  

  • Lead project management for revisions to the Playbook and other resources that support regional recruiter development  

  • Lead communications with recruitment community, including monthly newsletter, requests for data collection, updates on tools, etc.   

  • Product manage the KIPP recruitment tools, including our Applicant Tracking System, staffing plan, exemplars and templates for the Playbook; iterate on existing tools to align with research and best practices 

  • Support the planning of virtual learning sessions for regional recruiters to track data, get training on the use of recruitment tools, and share network-wide lessons learned  

  • Manage network-wide contracts with outside vendors and relevant communications with regions  

  • Design approach to measuring impact and adjust solutions based on data    

   

Team Leadership   

  • Contribute to cohesive execution of the team vision and collaboration across the team and the overall KIPP Foundation  

  • Connect with teammates to ensure coordination across the team, in service of our regions; look across the KIPP Foundation to ensure collaboration and cohesion of strategy; work effectively across lines of difference to drive our goals for equitable talent systems across the KIPP network 

 

Skills  

  • Tool & Product Development: Excellent product manager who can lead a product management process to create valuable, research-based, user-friendly, high-use tools 

  • Planning & Execution: Skilled at project management; able to own a project plan from kick-off to close-out, driving multiple competing priorities forward  

  • Critical Thinking & Problem Solving: Adept at problem solving and critical thinking; able to structure analyses, formulate hypotheses, gather and synthesize data, develop and assess alternatives and build a case for recommendations    

  • Stakeholder Management & Communication: Strong stakeholder manager who can build and engage in productive relationships with regional leaders to inform product development and refinement; can effectively communicate to stakeholders both verbally and in written form 

  • Mission & Student Focus: Deep commitment to both racial and educational equity; supports the building of an organization that reflects the community KIPP serves; holds self and others accountable for centering equity  

  • Cultural Competence & Commitment to Equity: A proactive cultural leader and team player who thrives on collaboration and learning; can effectively collaborate with teammates across lines of difference 



Qualifications

Experience and Qualifications 

  • 5+ years of relevant work experience operating in product development and/or management and/or knowledge management, ideally for a school system or in an education nonprofit  

  • Experience in the field of talent strategy highly preferred, including deep functional knowledge of recruitment processes and systems   

  • Track record of successful project management including the execution of on time work and ability to collaborate successfully with teammates and other partners  

  • Experience with an Applicant Tracking System a plus (SmartRecruiters, Salesforce, Workday, etc) 

 

Work Conditions 

  • The Senior Manager, Talent & Recruitment Consulting will report to the Director, Talent & Recruitment Consulting 

  • Travel requirements: Up to 10% 

  • Full-time, exempt role 



Additional Information

Work Conditions 

Willingness to travel frequently (10-12 days monthly and 4-6 consecutive weeks during the summer), including some weekends 

 

Location 

It is preferred, but not mandatory for this role to be based out of Washington DC given the focus on event planning in Policy and Public Affairs.  This role also has the option of working from a remote office full time.  KIPP Foundation office is in NYC, Chicago, San Francisco, and Washington DC.     

 

Compensation and Benefits
KIPP offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience. Our comprehensive benefits package include:

  • 20 vacation days + 18 days additional flexible PTO days (flexible PTO increases to 23 days for year 3 and 4 and to 28 days for years 5+).
  • 100% paid parental leave
  • 100% coverage of the premium for employee and 75% for employee + family’s medical/dental/vision plans.
  • Wellness benefits such as fitness reimbursements, discounted tickets to theme parks/attraction, back-up care support for children and adults/elders, and our employee assistance program
  • Finance Security benefits include such as a 401K retirement plan with 4% match, employer sponsored legal plans, and life/disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts
  •  

  

 

KIPP Foundation is an equal opportunity employer and an organization that values diversity. People from all diverse backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply.

results.title: Senior Security Engineer
results.description:
At HENI we believe in the importance of art, and the power of technology to radically advance and democratize the art industry. Our mission is to make art accessible to everyone, by engaging with and innovating within all aspects of its creation and distribution.

HENI prides itself on a connection with and commitment to cutting-edge technology across all our platforms. This is exemplified by our NFT Studio and marketplace, which have launched several fine art NFTs to date, starting with Damien Hirst’s The Currency. The Currency NFT collection has been very successful, with over $90M+ USD of secondary market trading since 27 July 2021, a significant amount of which has gone through the HENI NFT marketplace.

But HENI is much more than NFT’s!

HENI has a history in the physical art world and has developed platforms that focus on trading art, art education, art production, and publishing.

We also develop apps that use huge quantities of art-related data from across the globe. These apps are both web and mobile and use a variety of machine learning techniques to sort through and make sense of the data. Once launched recently was HENI News, an art news aggregation service.

Moreover, HENI also has a number of interactive and dynamic customer-facing websites, including e-commerce and streaming services.

Everything we develop is in-house and we have very strong engineering and data teams to make all this possible.

 

Technology at HENI

Our growing technical team contains a set of very capable Engineers, Data Scientists, DevOps, and supporting staff. We constantly tackle new and challenging problems – some of these solutions have involved developing our own in-house tools using machine learning, artificial intelligence, and augmented reality. Utilising modern cloud infrastructure and coding practices, we pride ourselves on exceeding the expectations of internal and external stakeholders. Using the very best tools, frameworks, and programming standards, including TDD, BDD, and Acceptance Criteria Testing, we aim to create a technical team that leads by example and excels in clean, readable, and modular code.

 

Position overview

We are looking to recruit a Senior Security Specialist; this specialist will be responsible for the full security spectrum with regard to technology within the business.

You will be responsible for implementing and maintaining a security policy, managing security risks, researching and being aware of new and old threats on the web (including cloud), Web3, and Blockchain stacks, ensuring user security and education are maintained throughout the HENI user sphere, performing security assessments, white hat attacks, mitigating risks, performing patches, advising on architecture risks, performing security due diligence of suppliers and interconnected businesses.

This is a stand-alone role within HENI and therefore, you will need to be a self-starter. It involves both policy writing and implementation. The initial task will involve a full assessment of HENI’s cyber and information security capability and produce recommendations on where we can improve.

Your background

We are looking for someone who has worked in a small to medium-sized business. Security is very different in a large-scale enterprise, and we want someone who can use their experience to assess threats specific to HENI.

You must have a background in cloud security, ideally AWS, as you will be working with our DevOps team to ensure our infrastructure is as secure as possible.

You need to have worked with a modern tech stack as well. Here at HENI, we take pride in utilising the latest tech to achieve our goals and you need to have experience in a similar environment.

results.title: Call Center Manager
results.description:
Company Description

FORWARD is a venture-backed company on a mission to build comprehensive solutions allowing governments to assist their communities at scale.

The FORWARD Platform is an Integrated Program Administration solution that incorporates all essential components, people, and technology into a single streamlined workflow to effectively, securely, and equitably administer critical resources to help communities thrive.

Municipalities nationwide are utilizing FORWARD to streamline the design, implementation, operations, communications, reporting, and compliance functions of their economic and community development assistance programs.

Our fully remote team works hard, but we fully embrace the advantages of this new paradigm. We work autonomously, collaborate asynchronously, and take ownership of our work. 



Job Description

The Call Center Manager will be responsible for the overall management of call center operations, being committed to delivering a great customer contact experience through a variety of channels which include phone, email, chat, and correspondence. Additionally, this role is responsible for managing, coaching and developing a high performing team that will meet and exceed operational performance goals. The Manager is results-driven and has a high commitment to excellence through continuous staff development programs enhancing employee engagement, service, knowledge, skills, and morale.

The role will lead continuous improvement of the customer experience with an emphasis on customer care, quality management, workforce planning, coaching and training. This role will be responsible for implementing and maintaining the Call Center IVR system for all active programs in addition to the automated email ticket system. In addition, this will be responsible for maintaining and improving upon FORWARD’s use of the Zendesk platform to better communicate with our customers.

Key Position Responsibilities

  • Manages, coaches, and develops direct reports by providing ongoing and timely feedback regarding performance, regular recognition, and encouragement.
  • Takes ownership of team’s operational performance, analyzes call center data, prepares reports, and identifies and implements process improvements to ensure most efficient use of resources.
  • Partner with Program Managers and other team members to ensure all new resources are launched correctly and timely within Zendesk and the call center IVR system.
  • Promotes and demonstrates a positive work atmosphere by communicating in a manner consistent with professional standards to work effectively with members, co-workers, management and vendors.
  • Develops and manages controls for both internal departments, external partners, and customers to ensure adherence to policies, procedures, and SLA’s.
  • Hires, onboards, and ensures all team members are properly trained.
  • Perform additional duties as required



Qualifications
  •  Minimum of 3+ years of management experience in a call center environment. Experience at a high growth, fast paced, or start up company is a plus.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education, training, or experience
  • Excellent problem-solving, organizational, analytical, verbal, and written communication skills.
  • Strong project management, decision making and time management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects/duties.
  • Results-driven and accountable to deadlines/goals established. Proven experience managing metrics, ensuring customer satisfaction
  • Strong mentoring and relationship building skills with ability to effectively manage group and interpersonal conflict situations
  • Effective leadership and analytical skills including working knowledge of training programs, staffing models, and scheduling
  • Experience using modern platforms and omni-channel communication (phone, chat, text, SMS)
  • Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills. Bi-lingual skills are a plus.
  • Advanced Excel skills and experience with data analysis to identify trends
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
  • Proficient in Zendesk
  • Legal eligibility to work in the U.S.



Additional Information

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

  • Fully remote position
  • Unlimited PTO
  • 100% employer paid medical and dental insurance
  • Stock Options
  • 401K Plan

results.title: Sales Account Executive (f/m/d)
results.description:
UK & Ireland Sales Account Executive (f/m/d)

Stratio is the World’s Leading Real-time Predictive Fleet Maintenance Platform. The company's proprietary technology combines large-scale processing with the latest machine learning techniques to prevent hundreds of thousands of breakdowns from happening every day, thus saving millions of people from the hassle of public transportation delays, postponed deliveries, or late arrival of essential goods. Stratio’s platform enables zero downtime for 5 of the 10 largest transportation companies in the world and, in 2021, raised an investment of $12 million to boost leadership in predictive fleet maintenance. Fleet operators in Europe, North America, Asia-pacific, and Latin America trust Stratio’s technology to fully leverage the data under the hood to safeguard operations, and keep customers happy. Stratio’s technology has enabled transportation for 1.3 billion people so far.



Your contribute to a #zerodowntimefuture

You’ll be joining our Sales team, which seeks to drive new customers to adopt our predictive maintenance solution and which is the commercial point of contact throughout their lifetime with us.

As Senior Sales Account Executive you will be responsible for generating incremental ARR in the UK and Ireland region, focused on the public transportation sector, waste management companies and truck distributors.

As Sales Account Executive you will
  • Work to meet, or exceed, the annual incremental ARR sales target;
  • Develop new customers/business for revenue growth;
  • Maintain and grow existing customer service/relationships;
  • Work with the Global Partner Manager to support and develop potential partners;
  • Collaborate with other sales for cross-sell and business expansion.

 

More specifically

  • Manage existing customer relationships in the territory with strategic and results-oriented efforts to avoid cancellations and accelerate growth in the accounts;
  • Develop and bring a robust pipeline of new business opportunities by extracting value from your personal network and through cooperation with marketing as well as with other members of the sales team;
  • Meet, or exceed, the set target for bringing incremental ARR to Stratio;
  • Work with the Global Partner Manager to manage the relationship with partners in the region.

 

We expect you to
  • Achieve the assigned iARR Sales Target;
  • Identify new of new opportunities within assigned accounts, and the identification of new potential customers;
  • Achieve Overall Territory Growth and Renewal Retention Rate Target. Take action to increase customer satisfaction, reduce cancellations, preserve and increase customer investment with Stratio;
  • Develop of Account Plans and customer profiles as well as Territory Plans and Sales Strategies;
  • Build long term solid relationships with the customer base;
  • To ensure the Company CRM system is accurate and up to date;
  • Deliver any requested reports on time, as well as accurate sales and renewal forecasts;
  • Attend any relevant events, trade shows or conferences, to discuss and demonstrate Stratio products;
  • Work closely with Marketing to drive campaigns in the region;
  • Coordinate with our Service team to deliver projects and develop customers.

 

This is what we believe is needed for this role
  • 5+ years of sales experience – preferably in the UK and Ireland region;
  • Understanding of consultative selling techniques - able to close deals and build relationships;
  • Ability to interact with and sell to senior-level management;
  • Ability to work as part of a team and autonomously, being able to be self-driven and self-directed;
  • Work in a virtual team with manager in a remote location;
  • Understanding of the legal environment of local markets, following directions from legal counsel on contract terms and conditions;
  • Comfortable working in a complex and fast-paced organization;
  • Availability to travel as necessary for the completion of work;
  • Full or native English proficiency;
  • Ability to independently use SaaS solutions and sell the benefits.


Bonus points

  • Excellent interpersonal and team playing skills;
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills.

 

What we offer
  • This job role has a compensation package structured in two components: base pay plus commission. Commission is earned by closing sales (meeting sales quota / target). The commission component is uncapped, meaning the sales executive will continue to earn commissions after the target (expected sales volume) is met;
  • Health Insurance;
  • Flexible Work Hours - adjust your schedule to your needs;
  • Remote Work Setup;
  • Monthly All-Hands;
  • Quarterly Events to discuss Strategy;
  • Autonomy and Ownership Culture;
  • Continuous feedback culture;
  • Innovation Mindset;
  • Career Acceleration.

 

Location
  • United Kingdom / Remote

 

What you can expect from our hiring process
  • Screening call with HR
  • 1st Interview (1h)
    HR and Hiring Manager
    We want to get to know you better and navigate through your experience, skills and motivation.
  • Technical Interview (1-2h)
    Hiring Manager
    Deep dive into your skills and assessment of your technical knowledge. 
  • Cultural Fit Interview (1h)
    HR Manager and one of our Founders
    Validate the cultural fit between you and Stratio and make sure you’re the person we’re looking for to help us build a #zerodowntimefuture.
  • Hiring Proposal

The process includes reference checking.

We want inspiring individuals in our teams, where age, race, gender, sexual orientation, politics and religion do not matter, and seek to create a tolerant and open space for everyone. We thrive to provide an inclusive and trustworthy environment.

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
We are ThinkShout, a fully distributed, certified B Corp dedicated to delivering exceptional web development, design, user experience, and strategy to the nonprofits and forward-thinking organizations that inspire us.

We're looking for a Senior Product Designer to lead project work, inspire our clients, and engage in shaping our design team in a time of critical department growth.. User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and inspiring communication. You’ll collaborate with fellow designers and departments to create innovative design solutions that have a greater impact for our clients.

Requirements

Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of relevant industry experience, designing large-scale websites and engaging digital products
  • A visual thinker with strong color, typographic, and UX/UI skills with a knack for design systems
  • Advanced level of proficiency with design programs like Figma and Adobe Creative Suite
  • Knowledge of how designs are applied in HTML and CSS as well as CMS platforms; Wordpress and Drupal are a plus
  • A deep understanding of accessible, inclusive and user-centered design practices
  • An awareness of the inherent white supremacy of design thinking and actively making efforts to decolonize one’s individual design practice
  • Strong communication skills, ability to present and defend work to peers and executive-level stakeholders
  • Experience working with existing brands and design systems in order to maintain brand voice and visual identity; Brand design experience a plus
  • Experience creating reusable components & design patterns to scale and fit variety of content and technical requirements as well as in-line with project budgets
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and an agile self-starter, able to contribute to projects with varying levels of direction, and pivot flexibly as project plans shift
  • Experience working independently and on multidisciplinary teams, and collaborating with strategists, developers and other designers in supporting large-scale projects
  • Dedication and self-management skills; Experience mentoring fellow designers a plus

Bonus Points:
  • Front-end development experience
  • Motion, video, interactive storytelling examples

Essential Responsibilities:
  • Owning and leading projects while collaborating closely with strategists, developers, and other designers to ideate, iterate, and bring innovative and intuitive solutions to the table
  • Building and maintaining creative offerings for ThinkShout's client work, participating in all UX and visual design stages of a project from concept through final hand-off to our development team, and serving as design advisor through implementation
  • Working within established brands and design systems; expanding them where needed
  • Creating, organizing, and documenting all your designs in Figma with extreme detail
  • Managing your time between projects of varying size and complexity with a dedicated focus to elevating your craft

Benefits

The Fine Print

ThinkShout is a fully distributed company and we welcome applications from candidates who have the unrestricted right to work in the USA.

ThinkShout is primarily a time and materials agency. In the role of Senior Product Designer, there is a weekly expectation of 30 billable hours. We work hard to maintain a 40 hour work week and we’re committed to supporting flexible schedules.

The salary band for this position is $80-105k. In addition, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, including:

  • Health insurance with dental, vision, and alternative care
  • Company funded Health Reimbursement Account
  • 401k with a 3% company contribution and no matching requirement
  • Quarterly Profit Share program
  • Life insurance and short term disability insurance
  • Paid Family and Medical Leave
  • 32 days of PTO annually, including holidays
  • Paid sabbatical after 5 years with the company
  • Professional development funds
  • Excellent management support and a well thought-out yearly review process


ThinkShout is made up of people with a variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We recognize that our company isn't as diverse as it should be and we're trying to change that. If you aren't sure whether you qualify, please apply anyway. We would much prefer to have an extra application to consider than for you to screen yourself out. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better (jobs@thinkshout.com). We are happy to accommodate.


Next Steps

Please submit a resume (no more than 2 pages) in PDF format. We request that you do not submit a cover letter. In its place, we have a few questions for you to answer in the job application. These questions will help us learn more about you and are an integral component of the interview process.

If you are selected to move forward, here’s what you can expect:

  • Round 1 is a 25-minute screening call
  • Round 2 is a 55-minute panel interview in which you will present a project from your portfolio followed by a Q&A
  • Round 3 is a 45-minute finalist interview

We are looking to fill this position for a January start date.

Please note that candidates must reside and be eligible to work in the United States.

results.title: Software Engineer - Backend
results.description:
ABOUT US

Retail returns suck. We all hate packing, printing, and shipping unwanted items only to wait weeks for a refund … And retailers have it rough too. They have to figure out what has to be re-sold, refurbished, or recycled, and if they don't figure it out fast enough, they might as well send everything to a landfill. Nobody wins.

This is why ReturnBear exists. We are Canada's first end-to-end reverse logistics solution. Our nationwide drop-off network means immediate exchanges and returns with no re-packing. We sort and QA goods to get inventory back to merchants fast, giving retailers 20%+ savings and making consumers happier. We make returns easy for everyone and better for the planet.

 

YOUR ROLE

As an engineer at ReturnBear, you'll get a chance to own a piece of the code that powers a key part of our business.  You'll be encouraged to speak with the product and operations teams and be actively involved in feature creation, rather than just passively deliver on feature requests. We feel that early input from engineering is key to success.

As an individual contributor, you'll be given the opportunity to specialize and do high quality work.  We want you to become an expert in your own domain.  You'll ship code but also be a part of peer reviewing your team's code.

We are looking for backend and fullstack engineers with at least 3 years of experience in some of the following technologies and frameworks.

Backend

  • Python
  • Django
    • GraphQL - Strawberry or Graphene
    • Public API generation and documentation
  • Testing

 

HIRING PROCESS

Candidates will be assessed at each of the following steps.

 

APPLICATION

  • We receive your profile, resume, etc.

 

INTRO: 15 min

  • Online conference call with Head of Engineering

 

TAKE-HOME EXERCISE: Return within 7 days of receiving. 

  • Open ended coding exercise submitted on GitHub

 

PAIR PROGRAMMING: 1.5 hours

 

  • With 2 engineering leads.
  • Real-world problem solving exercise.

 

CULTURE FIT WITH CEO: 45 min



COMPENSATION

Salary

  • We are a well-funded startup and can pay competitive salaries.

Benefits

  • Full health benefits

Equity

  • 0.008% to 0.01%



 
WHAT WE LOOK FOR
  • Ownership mentality. “It's their problem, not mine” doesn't have a place here. You own the problems and challenges that you see, and proactively work with your colleagues to turn them into opportunities. We're in it together!
  • Growth mindset. You learn from your mistakes and believe in human potential. It's not that you can't overcome the challenge you're facing, it's just that you haven't overcome it yet. You appreciate the diverse thoughts and perspectives of your colleagues, partners and clients, and you are committed to actively listening and learning.
  • Getting things done. You are keen to do great work, and ship things often. “Done is better than perfect” might be something you believe in, and while you always strive to deliver what is best for you and your team, you realize that sometimes you'll have to circle back on it to iterate and make improvements.
  • Flexibility and comfort in ambiguity. You embrace the agile nature of design and development, and you are equally comfortable pivoting your plan and process as you are establishing a workback schedule. Try as we might, things won't always go as planned, and you always try to be ready to deal with that as it comes.
  • Passion for the problems we're solving. You understand how ecommerce and retail ecosystems are growing with emerging brands and solution providers, and you're keen to make an impact not just on the lives of customers, but on the businesses of our merchant partners and on the environment as well. Together we can save merchants and their customers time and money, AND we can help keep returns out of landfills.
 
OUR COMMITMENTS
  • Diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates regardless of their background, sexuality, physical abilities and ways of self-identification.
  • Honing your craft, your way. We provide the opportunities to develop your skills and knowledge. We work collaboratively and flexibly, with opportunities to shape a hybrid working style suited to your needs.
  • All-you-can-pop bubble wrap. The popit craze has nothing on good ol' bubble wrap. Pop your way to zen, in true reverse logistics style.
